ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Conductive Hearing Loss (Left)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of chronic otitis media and tympanomastoidectomy; audiogram reveals significant air-bone gap with normal bone conduction.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assess hearing sensitivity given history of unilateral hearing loss and surgery.
Evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities to determine functional impact.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with normal hearing in the right ear and a moderate to profound conductive hearing loss in the left ear, consistent with the history of tympanomastoidectomy. Speech recognition is excellent in the left ear when presented at suprathreshold levels, indicating good potential for amplification.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal hearing (0-10 dB HL). Left ear: Moderate to profound conductive loss (AC 40-90 dB HL) with normal bone conduction (0-10 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: SRT 8 dB HL, WRS 100%. Left ear: SRT 52 dB HL, WRS 96% at 85 dB HL.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Not measured due to surgical history.

counseling_actions: Explained conductive nature of hearing loss related to surgical history
Discussed candidacy for amplification given excellent word recognition scores
Advised on requirement for medical clearance prior to hearing aid fitting

escalation.rationale_short: Medical clearance required for amplification due to conductive loss and surgical history.

expected_outcome: Recommendations included annual testing and evaluation for left ear amplification and HAT pending medical clearance.
